intro: Labichea lanceolata subsp. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceolate labichea, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive floral structure. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to several meters, with woody stems and pinnately compound leaves. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from white to pink, and it produces pods that contain seeds. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
